Class Game

java.lang.Object
project.game.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer, ToolEnvironment
public class Game extends Object implements ToolEnvironment, Observer
Represents the game grid and manages game logic, including node creation, initialization, and win condition checking.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Game create(int rows, int cols)
      Creates and returns a new game instance with the specified rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows in the grid.
      cols - the number of columns in the grid.
      Returns:
      a new game instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if rows or columns are less than 1.

    • rows

      public int rows()
      Returns the number of rows in the game grid.
      Specified by:
      rows in interface ToolEnvironment
      Returns:
      the number of rows.

    • cols

      public int cols()
      Returns the number of columns in the game grid.
      Specified by:
      cols in interface ToolEnvironment
      Returns:
      the number of columns.

    • fieldAt

      public ToolField fieldAt(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the field at the specified row and column.
      Specified by:
      fieldAt in interface ToolEnvironment
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      Returns:
      the game field at the specified position.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row or column is out of bounds.

    • createBulbNode

      public GameNode createBulbNode(Position p, Side sides)
      Creates a bulb node at the specified position with the given sides.
      Parameters:
      p - the position of the node.
      sides - the sides of the node.
      Returns:
      the created game node, or null if the position is invalid.

    • createPowerNode

      public GameNode createPowerNode(Position p, Side... sides)
      Creates a power source node at the specified position with the given sides.
      Parameters:
      p - the position of the node.
      sides - the sides of the node.
      Returns:
      the created game node, or null if the position is invalid or the source already exists.

    • createLinkNode

      public GameNode createLinkNode(Position p, Side... sides)
      Creates a wire node at the specified position with the given sides.
      Parameters:
      p - the position of the node.
      sides - the sides of the node.
      Returns:
      the created game node, or null if the position is invalid.

    • node

      public GameNode node(Position p)
      Retrieves the game node at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      p - the position of the node.
      Returns:
      the game node at the specified position, or null if the position is invalid.

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the game grid by resetting the power of all nodes and powering the source node.

    • getGame

      public GameNode[][] getGame()
      Returns the current game grid. The grid is represented as a 2D array of GameNode objects, where each node contains information about its type (e.g., bulb, wire, source) and its powered state.
      Returns:
      The 2D array representing the game grid.

    • someBulbsAreOn

      public boolean someBulbsAreOn()
      Checks if any bulb in the game is powered on. This method iterates through the game grid and checks if any GameNode of type NodeType.BULB is powered.
      Returns:
      true if at least one bulb is powered on, false otherwise.

    • update

      public void update(Observable o)
      This method is called when an Observable object (in this case, a GameNode) notifies its observers. It checks if the updated node is of type NodeType.WIRE, NodeType.BULB, or NodeType.SOURCE. If the node's sides are not fully connected (i.e., not equal to 4 sides), the game state is reinitialized. It also checks if the win state has changed and notifies the win listeners if necessary.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - The observable object that triggered the update. This will typically be a GameNode.

    • getWin

      public boolean getWin()
      Returns the current win state of the game.
      Returns:
      true if the game is won, false otherwise.

    • setWin

      public void setWin(Boolean win)
      Sets the win state of the game.
      Parameters:
      win - true if the game is won, false otherwise.

    • addGameWinListener

      public void addGameWinListener(GameWinListener listener)
      Adds a listener to be notified when the game win state changes.
      Parameters:
      listener - The GameWinListener to be added to the listener list.

    • removeGameWinListener

      public void removeGameWinListener(GameWinListener listener)
      Removes a listener that was previously added to be notified when the game win state changes.
      Parameters:
      listener - The GameWinListener to be removed from the listener list.
